text:
Akis: Protests confuse Hezbollah's agenda
03 Nov 2019, 06:54 by Lebanon 24
A member of the "strong republic" bloc MP George Aqis told Asharq Al-Awsat that the "revolution" that erupted on October 17 "confused the agenda of Hezbollah," noting that "whatever the mobilization of the foreign minister in the caretaker government Gibran Bassil Sunday on the anniversary Akis stressed that "the authority must realize that the clock will not go back before October 17," adding that "we, as Lebanese forces, have tried to change from within the government and that However, we have discovered that this structure and methodology cannot be changed in this country "The forces will not accept a techno-political government," he said. "There are people from this political structure who do not absorb themselves outside the government committee," he said. Prime Minister Saad Hariri is the most fortunate to form the next government. "The US adopts a policy of economic sanctions on countries that are hostile to its policy," he said, calling for Lebanon to be neutralized from the conflict in the region. "It is clear that this revolution has confused Hezbollah's agenda in Lebanon," he said. He called "Hezbollah" to "get us out of Lebanon and the external conflict and we do not want any problem with him and this call is sincere."
